message.content:
1. Patients were assessed for radiotherapy toxicity.
2. There was no difference in grade 3–4 oesophagitis between the groups.
3. 47 out of 254 patients in the twice-daily group had grade 3–4 oesophagitis.
4. 47 out of 246 patients in the once-daily group had grade 3–4 oesophagitis.
5. The p-value for the difference in grade 3–4 oesophagitis between the groups was 0.85.
6. There was no difference in grade 3–4 radiation pneumonitis between the groups.
7. 4 out of 254 patients in the twice-daily group had grade 3–4 radiation pneumonitis.
8. 4 out of 246 patients in the once-daily group had grade 3–4 radiation pneumonitis.
9. The p-value for the difference in grade 3–4 radiation pneumonitis between the groups was 0.70.

messages.content:
Statement: In patients assessed for radiotherapy toxicity, was no difference in grade 3–4 oesophagitis between the groups (47 [19%] of 254 patients in the twice-daily group vs 47 [19%] of 246 in the once-daily group; p=0·85) and grade 3–4 radiation pneumonitis (4 [3%] of 254 vs 4 [2%] of 246; p=0·70).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
